Learn how to handle version conflicts an: Learn how to handle version conflicts and implement concurrency control strategies
This guide explains how version conflict: This guide explains how version conflicts occur in the MBC CQRS Serverless Framework and provides strategies for prevention and recovery.
Version conflicts occur when two or more: Version conflicts occur when two or more operations attempt to update the same item simultaneously. In a distributed system like serverless applications, this is a common scenario that must be handled properly.
In this scenario, User B's update fails: In this scenario, User B's update fails because the item has already been updated by User A. The framework uses DynamoDB's conditional writes to detect this situation.
The framework implements optimistic lock: The framework implements optimistic locking through the `version` field on each item. This approach assumes conflicts are rare and handles them when they occur, rather than locking resources preemptively.
VERSION_FIRST = 0: Used when creating ne: VERSION_FIRST = 0: Used when creating new items
VERSION_LATEST = -1: Auto-resolve to the: VERSION_LATEST = -1: Auto-resolve to the latest version
When publishing a command, the framework: When publishing a command, the framework:
Checks the input version against the cur: Checks the input version against the current item's version
Uses DynamoDB conditional expression `at: Uses DynamoDB conditional expression `attribute_not_exists(pk) AND attribute_not_exists(sk)` to ensure uniqueness
If another update occurred first, Dynamo: If another update occurred first, DynamoDB throws `ConditionalCheckFailedException`
The framework converts this to HTTP 409: The framework converts this to HTTP 409 Conflict response
When updating an item, always include th: When updating an item, always include the current version number:
First, get the current item to know its: First, get the current item to know its version

When to Use VERSION_FIRST vs VERSION_LAT: When to Use VERSION_FIRST vs VERSION_LATEST

Creating a new item that doesn't exist y: Creating a new item that doesn't exist yet
The item should have version 1 after cre: The item should have version 1 after creation
You want to update regardless of current: You want to update regardless of current version
Conflicts are acceptable and the latest: Conflicts are acceptable and the latest data should win
Using `VERSION_LATEST` bypasses conflict: Using `VERSION_LATEST` bypasses conflict detection. Only use it when you intentionally want to overwrite any concurrent changes. For most use cases, you should use the actual version number from the current item.
